even as we are one four months of
training
for four long months march april may and

this tearing time continued jesus held
over 100 long and earnest
though cheerful and joyous sessions with

james
owing to sickness in his family jude

james jesus's brother did not lose faith

i cannot understand him i cannot figure

throughout these four months these seven

jesus possessed that matchless grace of

that they were not dismayed by his

god incarnate in the likeness of mortal

this time of waiting severely tested the

nothing absolutely nothing miraculous

day by day they went about their
ordinary work while night after night

and they were held together by his

this period of waiting and teaching was

be patient simon make progress we shall
none too ready when the father calls

he never grew wary of contemplating how

throughout this entire period jesus

in this time of waiting jesus endeavored

what their attitude should be toward the
various religious groups and the
political parties of palestine

to win
all of them but we are not of any of

the scribes and the rabbis taken
together were called pharisees
they referred to themselves as the
associates in many ways they were the
progressive group among the jews
having adopted many teachings not
clearly found in the hebrew scriptures
such as belief in the resurrection of
the dead a doctrine
only mentioned by a later prophet daniel
the sadducees consisted of the
priesthood and certain wealthy jews
they were not such sticklers for the
detail of law enforcement
the pharisees and sodasies were really
religious parties rather than sex
the essenes were a true religious sect
originating during the maccabean period
whose requirements were in some respects
more exacting than those of the
pharisees
they had adapted many persian beliefs
and practices
lived as a brotherhood in monasteries
refrained from marriage
and in all things in common they
specialized in teaching about angels
the zealots were a group of intense
jewish patriots they advocated that any
and all methods were justified in the
struggle to escape the bondage of the
roman yoke
the haradians were a purely political
party that advocated
emancipation from the direct roman rule
by the restoration of the herodian
dynasty
in the very midst of palestine there
lived the samaritans
with whom the jews had no dealings
notwithstanding that they held many
views similar to the jewish teachings
all of these parties and sects including
the smaller nazarite brotherhood
believed in the sometime coming of the
messiah they all looked for a national
deliverer
but jesus was very positive in making it
clear that he and his disciples
would not become allied to any of these
schools or thought of practice
the son of man was to be neither a
nazarite nor in a scene
